TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SyndicationItem extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TypeForwardedFrom("System.ServiceModel.Web, Version=3.5.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35")

Docs.summary: Represents a feed item, for example an RSS or an Atom .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance is written to an `<entry>` element. The following table shows how each property defined for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> is serialized for Atom 1.0.
|SyndicationItem property|Serialized form| |------------------------------|---------------------| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.AttributeExtensions%2A>|Attribute in the `<entry>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A>|An `<author>` element for each author in the collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Categories%2A>|A`<category>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A>|A`<content>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A>|A`<contributor>` element for each contributor in the collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Copyright%2A>|A`<rights>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.ElementExtensions%2A>|Element in the `<entry>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Id%2A>|An `<id>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.LastUpdatedTime%2A>|An `<updated>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Links%2A>|A `<link>` element for each link in the collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.PublishDate%2A>|A `<published>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.SourceFeed%2A>|A `<source>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Summary%2A>|A `<summary>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Title%2A>|A `<title>` element.|
When serialized to RSS 2.0, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance is written to an `<item>` element. The following table shows how each property defined for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> is serialized for RSS 2.0.
|SyndicationItem property|Serialized form| |------------------------------|---------------------| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.AttributeExtensions%2A>|Attribute in the `<item>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A>|A `<managingEditor>` if only one <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection; otherwise, the `<a10:author>` element for each author in the collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Categories%2A>|A `<category>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A>|An `<a10:content>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A>|An `<a10:contributor>` element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Copyright%2A>|A `<copyright>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.ElementExtensions%2A>|Element in the `<item>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Id%2A>|An `<a10:id>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.LastUpdatedTime%2A>|An `<a10:updated>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Links%2A>|A `<link>` element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Links%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.PublishDate%2A>|A `<pubDate>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.SourceFeed%2A>|A `<source>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Summary%2A>|A `<description>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Title%2A>|A `<title>` element.|

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AttributeExtensions As Dictionary(Of XmlQualifiedName, String)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::Dictionary<System::Xml::XmlQualifiedName ^, System::String ^> ^ AttributeExtensions { System::Collections::Generic::Dictionary<System::Xml::XmlQualifiedName ^, System::String ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the attribute extensions for the syndication item.
Docs.value: A dictionary that contains a collection of attribute extensions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Syndication object model allows you to add custom attributes to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance. When serialized for Atom 1.0, the custom attribute is written to an `<entry>` element. When serialized for RSS 2.0, the custom attribute is written to an `<item>` element. For a complete example that shows how to add an attribute extension, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/loosely-typed-extensions-sample.md) sample.
## Examples The following code shows how to add an attribute extension to a syndication feed.
[!code-csharp[LooselyTypedExtensions#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/looselytypedextensions/cs/snippets.cs#3)] [!code-vb[LooselyTypedExtensions#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/looselytypedextensions/vb/snippets.vb#3)]
The following XML code shows an Atom 1.0 serialization of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance with a custom attribute called `itemAttrib`.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#4](~/samples/snippets/common/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/common/atom.xml#4)]
The following code shows the same <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance serialized as RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#5](~/samples/snippets/common/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/common/rss.xml#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Authors As Collection(Of SyndicationPerson)

Docs.summary: Gets the authors of the syndication item.
Docs.value: A collection of objects that represent the authors of the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serializing to Atom 1.0, an `<author>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection.
When serializing to RSS 2.0. a `<managingEditor>` element is written if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection has only one <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson>, otherwise a `<a10:author>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection.
## Examples The following code shows how to add an author to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.

[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#7](~/samples/snippets/common/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/common/rss.xml#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::ServiceModel::Syndication::SyndicationContent ^ Content { System::ServiceModel::Syndication::SyndicationContent ^ get(); void set(System::ServiceModel::Syndication::SyndicationContent ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the content of the syndication item.
Docs.value: A instance that contains the content of the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent> is a base class for all syndication content types. The [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] defines the following syndication content types:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent>
You can assign this property to any of these content types (or possibly a user-defined type derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent>).
For Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A> property is serialized to a `<content>` element.
For RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A> property is serialized to a `<description>` element for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent>, a `<a10:content>` element for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent>.
## Examples The following code shows how to add content to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.
[!code-csharp[SyndicationItem#24](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/cs/program.cs#24)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#24](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/vb/snippets.vb#24)]
The following XML shows how the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A> property is serialized for Atom 1.0.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <content type="text">This is some content</content> ```
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <content type="text/html" src="http://myurl/" /> ```
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <content type="MyXMLType"> <mg:MyElement xmlns:mg="http://migree/elements">This is some text</mg:MyElement> </content> ```
The following XML shows how the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A> property is serialized for RSS 2.0.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <description>This is some content</description> ```
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <a10:content type="text/html" src="http://myurl/" /> ```
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <a10:content type="MyXMLType"> <mg:MyElement xmlns:mg="http://migree/elements">This is some text</mg:MyElement> </a10:content> ```

Docs.summary: Gets the contributors of the syndication item.
Docs.value: A collection of objects that represent the contributors of the syndication item.

remarks.format:

When serialized to RSS 2.0, a `<a10:contributor>` element is created for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the copyright information for the syndication item.

remarks.format:

## Examples The following code shows how to add copyright information to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.

``` <rights type="text">Copyright 2007</rights> ```
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
``` <a10:rights type="text">Copyright 2007</a10:rights> ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks This does not add the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ElementExtensions As SyndicationElementExtensionCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the element extensions contained in the syndication item.
Docs.value: A that contains the element extensions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. Any valid XML element can be added as an extension provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. When serialized, extensions are written like any other XML element.
``` <mg:MyElement xmlns:mg="http://myserver/elements" /> ```
For a complete example that shows how to add element extensions, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/loosely-typed-extensions-sample.md) sample.
## Examples The following code shows how to add element extensions to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20ItemFormatter GetRss20Formatter(bool serializeExtensionsAsAtom) cil managed
Public Function GetRss20Formatter (serializeExtensionsAsAtom As Boolean) As Rss20ItemFormatter

Docs.param: A value that specifies whether to serialize element and attribute extensions with an Atom 1.0 namespace.
Docs.summary: Gets an instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks RSS 2.0 allows elements and attributes that are not in its specification only if they are within a namespace. When the `serializedExtensionsAsAtom` parameter is `true`, the formatter automatically adds the "a10" namespace to all extensions; otherwise, the extensions are not serialized.
## Examples The following code shows how to write a syndication item in RSS 2.0 format to an XML file, serializing attribute and element extensions.
[!code-csharp[SyndicationItem#44](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/cs/program.cs#44)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#44](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/vb/snippets.vb#44)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the syndication item.
Docs.value: The ID of the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to the `<id>` element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to the `<guid>` element.
## Examples The following code shows how to set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Id%2A> property on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.
[!code-csharp[SyndicationItem#27](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/cs/program.cs#27)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#27](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/syndicationitem/vb/snippets.vb#27)]
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <id>Item ID</id> ```
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
``` <guid isPermaLink="false">Item ID</guid> ```

The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
``` <a10:updated>2007-03-19T20:34:23Z</a10:updated> ```

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the source feed of the syndication item.
Docs.value: A instance where the syndication item is located.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not automatically set when you add a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> - you must explicitly set it. When serialized to Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<source>` element. The contents of that element vary depending on the format you serialize to.

MemberSignature.Value: protected internal virtual bool TryParseAttribute (string name, string ns, string value, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryParseAttribute(string name, string ns, string value, string version) cil managed
Protected Friend Overridable Function TryParseAttribute (name As String, ns As String, value As String, version As String) As Boolean
protected public: virtual bool TryParseAttribute(System::String ^ name, System::String ^ ns, System::String ^ value, System::String ^ version);
abstract member TryParseAttribute : string * string * string * string -> bool override this.TryParseAttribute : string * string * string * string -> bool

Docs.param: The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
Docs.summary: Attempts to parse an attribute extension.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the `<entry>` (for Atom 1.0) or `<item>` (for RSS 1.0) element, depending upon the syndication version being used. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

Docs.param: The to read from.
The syndication version to use while parsing.
Docs.summary: Attempts to parse an element extension.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the element extension was parsed successfully.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
